medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began with a significant decline in renal function noted by the nephrologist on routine lab work. The patient presented to the ED after attempts to reach him for evaluation took about a week. The renal function worsened from a baseline creatinine of 1.7-1.8 to 3.0 and then to 3.7 upon repeat testing in the ED. There was notable anasarca observed on examination.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Chronic kidney disease stage 3, Nephrotic syndrome/FSGS (steroid resistant), Hypoalbuminemia, Anemia, Secondary hyperparathyroidism, MGUS, Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Gout, Atrial afib/flutter, Provoked lower extremity DVT, Erectile dysfunction, Gynecomastia, Neuropathy, Hypothyroidism, Bowel microperforations with E.coli & pseudomonal peritonitis and intra-abdominal abscess s/p drainage.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had breast cancer, deceased. Father is deceased. Family history of kidney disease.
